project.name: postprocessing
project.description: A post processing library that provides the means to implement 2D filter effects for three.js.

materials.name: materials
materials.description: A collection of shader materials that are used in the post processing passes.

passes.name: passes
passes.description: A compilation of the post processing passes.

BokehMaterial.name: BokehMaterial
BokehMaterial.description:
Depth of Field shader (Bokeh).

Original code by Martins Upitis:
 http://artmartinsh.blogspot.com/2010/02/glsl-lens-blur-filter-with-bokeh.html

props.name: focus
props.description: - Focus distance.

props.name: aspect
props.description: - Camera aspect factor.

props.name: aperture
props.description: - Camera aperture scale. Bigger values for shallower depth of field.

props.name: maxBlur
props.description: - Maximum blur strength.

Bokeh2Material.name: Bokeh2Material
Bokeh2Material.description:
Depth of Field shader version 2.

Original code by Martins Upitis:
 http://blenderartists.org/forum/showthread.php?237488-GLSL-depth-of-field-with-bokeh-v2-4-(update)

props.name: texelSize
props.description: - The absolute screen texel size.

props.name: showFocus
props.description: - Whether the focus point should be highlighted.

props.name: manualDoF
props.description: - Enables manual depth of field blur.

props.name: vignette
props.description: - Enables a vignette effect.

props.name: pentagon
props.description: - Enable to use a pentagonal shape to scale gathered texels.

props.name: shaderFocus
props.description: - Disable if you compute your own focalDepth (in metres!).

props.name: noise
props.description: - Disable if you don't want noise patterns for dithering.

CombineMaterial.name: CombineMaterial
CombineMaterial.description: A material for combining two textures.

params.name: invertTexture1
params.description: - Invert the first texture's rgb values.

params.name: invertTexture2
params.description: - Invert the second texture's rgb values.

ConvolutionMaterial.name: ConvolutionMaterial
ConvolutionMaterial.description:
A convolution blur shader material.

Use this shader five times in a row while adjusting the kernel before each
render call in order to get a result similar to a 35x35 Gauss filter.

Based on the GDC2003 Presentation by Masaki Kawase, Bunkasha Games:
Frame Buffer Postprocessing Effects in DOUBLE-S.T.E.A.L (Wreckless)

Further modified according to:
 https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/3DDrawing/Conceptual/OpenGLES_ProgrammingGuide/BestPracticesforShaders/BestPracticesforShaders.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40008793-CH7-SW15

params.name: average
params.description: - Whether the shader should output the colour average (black and white).

FilmMaterial.name: FilmMaterial
FilmMaterial.description:
A cinematic shader that provides the following effects:
 - Film Grain
 - Scanlines
 - Vignette
 - Greyscale
 - Sepia

Original scanlines algorithm by Pat "Hawthorne" Shearon.
 http://www.truevision3d.com/forums/showcase/staticnoise_colorblackwhite_scanline_shaders-t18698.0.html

Optimized scanlines and noise with intensity scaling by Georg "Leviathan"
Steinrohder. (This version is provided under a Creative Commons Attribution
3.0 License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0)

The sepia effect is based on:
 https://github.com/evanw/glfx.js

The vignette code is based on PaintEffect postprocess from ro.me:
 http://code.google.com/p/3-dreams-of-black/source/browse/deploy/js/effects/PaintEffect.js

props.name: greyscale
props.description: - Enable greyscale effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

props.name: sepia
props.description: - Enable sepia effect. Greyscale and sepia are mutually exclusive.

props.name: vignette
props.description: - Apply vignette effect.

props.name: eskil
props.description: - Use Eskil's vignette approach. The default looks dusty while Eskil looks burned out.

props.name: scanlines
props.description: - Show scanlines.

props.name: noise
props.description: - Show noise-based film grain.

props.name: noiseIntensity
props.description: - The noise intensity. 0.0 to 1.0.

props.name: scanlineIntensity
props.description: - The scanline intensity. 0.0 to 1.0.

props.name: greyscaleIntensity
props.description: - The intensity of the greyscale effect.

props.name: sepiaIntensity
props.description: - The intensity of the sepia effect.

props.name: vignetteOffset
props.description: - The offset of the vignette effect.

props.name: vignetteDarkness
props.description: - The darkness of the vignette effect.

GlitchMaterial.name: GlitchMaterial
GlitchMaterial.description:
A glitch shader material.

Reference:
 https://github.com/staffantan/unityglitch

GodRaysMaterial.name: GodRaysMaterial
GodRaysMaterial.description:
A crepuscular rays shader material.

References:

Thibaut Despoulain, 2012:
 (WebGL) Volumetric Light Approximation in Three.js
 http://bkcore.com/blog/3d/webgl-three-js-volumetric-light-godrays.html

Nvidia, GPU Gems 3, 2008:
 Chapter 13. Volumetric Light Scattering as a Post-Process
 http://http.developer.nvidia.com/GPUGems3/gpugems3_ch13.html

LuminosityMaterial.name: LuminosityMaterial
LuminosityMaterial.description:
A luminance shader material.

This shader produces a greyscale luminance map. It can also be configured to
output colors that are scaled with their respective luminance value.
Additionally, a range may be provided to mask out undesired texels.

The alpha channel will remain unaffected in all cases.

Luminance range reference:
 https://cycling74.com/2007/05/23/your-first-shader/#.Vty9FfkrL4Z

params.name: color
params.description: - Defines whether the shader should output colours scaled with their luminance value.

params.name: range
params.description: - If provided, the shader will mask out texels that aren't in the specified range.

SMAABlendMaterial.name: SMAABlendMaterial
SMAABlendMaterial.description:
Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing.

This material is used to render the final antialiasing.

SMAAColorEdgesMaterial.name: SMAAColorEdgesMaterial
SMAAColorEdgesMaterial.description:
Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing.

This material detects edges in a color texture.

SMAAWeightsMaterial.name: SMAAWeightsMaterial
SMAAWeightsMaterial.description:
Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing.

This material computes weights for detected edges.

BloomPass.name: BloomPass
BloomPass.description:
A bloom pass.

This pass renders a scene with superimposed blur by utilising the fast Kawase
convolution approach.

props.name: resolutionScale
props.description: - The render texture resolution scale, relative to the screen render size.

props.name: blurriness
props.description: - The scale of the blur.

props.name: strength
props.description: - The bloom strength.

props.name: distinction
props.description: - The luminance distinction factor. Raise this value to bring out the brighter elements in the scene.

BokehPass.name: BokehPass
BokehPass.description: Depth of Field pass using a bokeh shader.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The main camera. Used to adjust the near and far plane settings.

props.name: focus
props.description: - Focus distance.

props.name: aperture
props.description: - Camera aperture scale. Bigger values for shallower depth of field.

props.name: maxBlur
props.description: - Maximum blur strength.

Bokeh2Pass.name: Bokeh2Pass
Bokeh2Pass.description:
Depth of Field pass version 2.

This pass yields more realistic results but is also more demanding.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The main camera. Used to adjust near and far plane and focal length settings.

props.name: rings
props.description: - The amount of blur rings.

props.name: samples
props.description: - The amount of samples per ring.

props.name: showFocus
props.description: - Whether the focus point should be highlighted.

props.name: manualDoF
props.description: - Enables manual depth of field blur.

props.name: vignette
props.description: - Enables a vignette effect.

props.name: pentagon
props.description: - Enable to use a pentagonal shape to scale gathered texels.

props.name: shaderFocus
props.description: - Disable if you compute your own focalDepth (in metres!).

props.name: noise
props.description: - Disable if you don't want noise patterns for dithering.

props.name: angle
props.description: - The angle of the pattern.

props.name: scale
props.description: - The scale of the overall effect.

props.name: intensity
props.description: - The intensity of the effect.

props.name: average
props.description: - Whether the shader should output a colour average (black and white).

FilmPass.description: A film pass providing various cinematic effects.

props.name: greyscale

props.name: scanlines

props.name: intensity

props.name: blurriness

Pass.name: Pass
Pass.description:
An abstract pass.

This class implements a dispose method that frees memory on demand.
The EffectComposer calls this method when it is being destroyed.

For this mechanism to work properly, please assign your render targets,
materials or textures directly to your pass!

You can prevent your disposable objects from being deleted by keeping them
inside deeper structures such as arrays or objects.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The camera will be added to the given scene if it has no parent.

params.name: quad
params.description: - A quad that fills the screen. Used for rendering a pure 2D effect. Set this to null, if you don't need it (see RenderPass).

RenderPass.name: RenderPass
RenderPass.description:
A pass that renders a given scene directly on screen or into the read buffer
for further processing.

params.name: camera
params.description: - The camera to use to render the scene.

props.name: overrideMaterial
props.description: - An override material for the scene.

props.name: clearColor
props.description: - An override clear color.

props.name: clearAlpha
props.description: - An override clear alpha.

SavePass.name: SavePass
SavePass.description: A pass that renders the result from a previous pass to another render target.

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - The render target to use for saving the read buffer.

params.name: resize
params.description: - Whether the render target should adjust to the size of the read/write buffer.

ShaderPass.name: ShaderPass
ShaderPass.description:
A shader pass.

Used to render any shader material as a 2D filter.

SMAAPass.name: SMAAPass
SMAAPass.description:
Subpixel Morphological Antialiasing (SMAA) v2.8.

Preset: SMAA 1x Medium (with color edge detection).
 https://github.com/iryoku/smaa/releases/tag/v2.8

params.name: Image
params.description: - This pass requires an Image class to create internal textures. Provide window.Image in a browser environment.

ToneMappingPass.name: ToneMappingPass
ToneMappingPass.description:
A tone mapping pass that supports adaptive luminosity.

If adaptivity is enabled, this pass generates a texture that represents the
luminosity of the current scene and adjusts it over time to simulate the
optic nerve responding to the amount of light it is receiving.

Reference:
 GDC2007 - Wolfgang Engel, Post-Processing Pipeline
 http://www.graphics.cornell.edu/~jaf/publications/sig02_paper.pdf

props.name: adaptive
props.description: - Whether the tone mapping should use an adaptive luminance map.

props.name: resolution
props.description: - The render texture resolution.

props.name: distinction
props.description: - A luminance distinction factor.

EffectComposer.name: EffectComposer
EffectComposer.description:
The EffectComposer may be used in place of a normal WebGLRenderer.

It will disable the auto clear behaviour of the provided renderer to prevent
unnecessary clear operations. The depth buffer will also be disabled for
writing. Passes that rely on the depth test must explicitly enable it.

You may want to use a {{#crossLink "RenderPass"}}{{/crossLink}} as your first
pass to automatically clear the screen and render the scene to a texture for
further processing.

params.name: renderer
params.description: - The renderer that should be used in the passes.

params.name: depthTexture
params.description: - Set to true, if one of your passes relies on the depth of the main scene.

params.name: stencilBuffer
params.description: - Whether the main render targets should have a stencil buffer.

classitems.description:
The number of samples per pixel.

This value must be carefully chosen. A higher value increases the GPU load
directly and doesn't necessarily yield better results!
classitems.name: samples

classitems.description:
Renders the scene.

The read buffer is assumed to contain the normally rendered scene.
The god rays pass has four phases with a total of 8 render steps.

Mask Phase:
 The scene is rendered using a mask material.

Preliminary Blur Phase:
 The masked scene is blurred five consecutive times.

God Rays Phase:
 The blurred scene is blurred again, but this time along radial lines
 towards the light source.

Composite Phase:
 The final result is added to the normal scene.
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Adjusts the format and size of the render targets.
classitems.name: initialise

The buffers will both be cleared first.

The quad mesh to use for rendering.

Assign your shader material to this mesh!

classitems.description:
Indicates whether the read and write buffers should be swapped after this
pass has finished rendering.

Set this to true if this pass renders to the write buffer so that a
following pass can find the result in the read buffer.
classitems.name: needsSwap

classitems.description: Enabled flag.
classitems.name: enabled

classitems.description: Render to screen flag.
classitems.name: renderToScreen

classitems.description:
Renders the effect.

This is an abstract method that must be overridden.
classitems.name: render

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

params.name: readBuffer
params.description: - A read buffer. Contains the result of the previous pass.

params.name: writeBuffer
params.description: - A write buffer. Normally used as the render target.

params.name: maskActive
params.description: - Indicates whether a stencil test mask is active or not.

classitems.description:
Performs initialisation tasks.

By implementing this abstract method you gain access to the renderer.
You'll also be able to configure your custom render targets to use the
appropriate format (RGB or RGBA).

The provided renderer can be used to warm up special off-screen render
targets by performing a preliminary render operation.

The effect composer calls this method when this pass is added to its queue.
classitems.name: initialise

params.name: alpha
params.description: - Whether the renderer uses the alpha channel or not.

classitems.description:
Updates this pass with the renderer's size.

This is an abstract method that may be overriden in case you want to be
informed about the main render size.

The effect composer calls this method when its own size is updated.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description:
Performs a shallow search for properties that define a dispose method and
deletes them. The pass will be inoperative after this method was called!

Disposable objects:
 - render targets
 - materials
 - textures

The EffectComposer calls this method automatically when it is being
destroyed. You may, however, use it independently to free memory
when you are certain that you don't need this pass anymore.
classitems.name: dispose

classitems.description: Used for saving the original clear color during rendering.

The read buffer.

Reading from and writing to the same render target should be avoided.
Therefore, two seperate, yet identical buffers are used.

params.description: - The time between the last frame and the current one in seconds.

classitems.description:
Sets the size of the buffers and the renderer's output canvas.

Every pass will be informed of the new size. It's up to each pass how that
information is used.

If no width or height is specified, the render targets and passes will be
updated with the current size of the renderer.
classitems.name: setSize

classitems.description: Resets this composer by deleting all passes and creating new buffers.
classitems.name: reset

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - A new render target to use. If none is provided, the settings of the renderer will be used.

classitems.description:
Destroys all passes and render targets.

This method deallocates all render targets, textures and materials created
by the passes. It also deletes this composer's frame buffers.

Note: the reset method uses the dispose method internally.
classitems.name: dispose

params.name: renderTarget
params.description: - A new render target. If none is provided, the composer will become inoperative.
